titlestmt.titleproper: Register to the Marion V. Littlefield photograph collection

publicationstmt.p: Hoover Institution Archives. All rights reserved.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid created derived from MARC record and photograph catalog. Date of source: 2008

titlepage.titleproper: Register to the Marion V. Littlefield photograph collection
titlepage.publisher:
Hoover Institution Archives
Stanford University
Stanford, California
titlepage.p: © 2008 Hoover Institution Archives. All rights reserved.

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.abstract: Depicts aerial activities on the western front during World War I, captured or destroyed German planes, and bomb damage in France and Germany. Photographs taken by the United States Air Service.
did.langmaterial: Languages represented in the collection: English

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research. Access to audiovisual materials requires at least two weeks advance notice. Audiovisual materials include sound recordings, video recordings, and motion picture film. Hoover staff will determine whether use copies of the materials requested can be made available. Some materials may not be accessible even with advance notice. Please contact the Hoover Institution Archives for further information.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Marion V. Littlefield photograph collection, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in YEAR

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the library's online public access catalog.

did.unittitle: 31 prints. Identified individuals and groups of individuals.
26 prints. Aircraft wrecks with pilots identified.
19 prints. Aircraft wrecks with pilots not identified.
29 prints. Aircraft in flight and on the ground.
14 prints. War damage to French towns.
4 prints. Funeral of Capt. von Glascow
3 prints. German Crown Prince reviewing troops.
10 prints. Views of cities, buildings, etc.
8 prints. Views of non-aviation military equipments and arms.
